author.department: Department of Mathematics and Computer Science

introduction.p: This is a literate programming version of the RELAX-NG schema for 's Pulbication Files. It is based on the corresponding version for 's RELAX-NG schema written by Rob Beezer. It is used to generate the RELAX-NG compact syntax version (pretext.rnc) and other versions are derived from the compact version with standard tools.

The main use for this schema currently is to let publishers more easily write publication files for projects since the pretext-tools extension for VS Code uses (the derived version) of this schema to provide completions and (eventually) validation.
Comments in this file are kept to a minimum. Full documentation of publisher options are presented in the guide.
More information about how RELAX-NG schemas work, as well as how the literate programming version of this schema works, can be found in the schema.

section.title: Start Element
section.p: The only start element for a publication file is publication.

section.title: Gross Structure
section.p: A publication file always has the root element publication. After that, all elements are optional. Those elements include common options, and options for numbering, latex, html, reveal.js, epub, source, and . These can come in any order.

fragment.title: Gross structure
fragment.code: Publication = element publication { Common? & Source? & Numbering? & Latex? & Html? & Revealjs? & Epub? & Webwork? }

section.title: Hierarchical Structure
section.p: We collect all the specifications, roughly in a top-down order, so the generated schema files have a rational ordering to them, even if the order presented here is different.
